currently watching

audrey and i finished season 2 of young royals and it was fantastic. i was on the edge of my seat the entire time! i thought the tension built up so perfectly; when wille stood up to give his speech after spending the entire episode having an extreme anxiety breakdown, i genuinely had no idea how it was going to go. and then when he went off script and said ‚Äúfuck tradition, that was me having gay sex in that video! and i liked it!‚Äù i was shaking crying screaming throwing up. period!!! as totally ridiculous as the whole premise of this show is, what i love is that at its core it‚Äôs about letting yourself seize the love that is there for the taking; about being open and honest and loyal; about trying to do right by someone else. when simon said i love you to wille i felt it physically in my chest. no notes whatsoever! perfect television! season 3 can‚Äôt come soon enough!

i also started watching sherwood. sorry but it‚Äôs january and sometimes you just need a hit of copaganda! there‚Äôs something so profoundly relaxing and compelling about the beats of these bbc procedural shows. this one takes place in a nottinghamshire mining village, which was predominantly a UDM town during the strikes (aka breaking the NUM line and going back to work in the pits). although it‚Äôs set 30 years on, the town‚Äôs memory is long and the scars of that divisive time still haven‚Äôt healed. i‚Äôm intrigued, but also prepared to roll my eyes at whatever half-baked political analysis is inserted in there.

here‚Äôs helena fitzgerald on the topic:
